name: JFrogGenericArtifacts
description: Run generic commands with Artifactory using FileSpecs, while allowing to collect build-info. The collected build-info can be later published to Artifactory by the "JFrog Publish Build Info" task.
author: JFrog

inputs.name: command
inputs.label: Command
inputs.helpMarkDown: The generic command to be run by this task.

inputs.name: connection
inputs.label: Artifactory service connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Artifactory service to be used by this task.

inputs.name: setProps
inputs.label: Properties to set
inputs.helpMarkDown: The list of properties, in the form of key1=value1;key2=value2,..., to be set on the matching artifacts.

inputs.name: deleteProps
inputs.label: Properties to delete
inputs.helpMarkDown: The list of properties, in the form of key1,key2,..., to be deleted from the matching artifacts.

inputs.name: specSource
inputs.label: File spec source
inputs.helpMarkDown: To specify the affected files in Artifactory, please create a File Spec. To read more about the File Spec schema click here.

inputs.name: fileSpec
inputs.label: Spec
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use file spec from task configuration.

inputs.name: file
inputs.label: File path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use file spec from a local file.

inputs.name: replaceSpecVars
inputs.label: Replace spec variables
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select to replace variables in your File Spec.
In the File Spec, the variables should be used as follows: ${key1}.

inputs.name: specVars
inputs.label: Spec vars
inputs.helpMarkDown:
List of Spec vars.
List of variables in the form of "key1=value1;key2=value2;..." to be replaced in the File Spec.

inputs.name: collectBuildInfo
inputs.label: Collect build info
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select to collect build info and store it locally.
The build info can be later published to Artifactory using the "JFrog Publish Build Info" task.

inputs.name: buildName
inputs.label: Build name
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Build name.
To use the default build name of the pipeline, set the field to '$(Build.DefinitionName)'.
The collected build-info should be published to Artifactory using the 'JFrog Publish Build Info' task.

inputs.name: buildNumber
inputs.label: Build number
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Build number.
To use the default build number of the pipeline, set the field to '$(Build.BuildNumber)'.
The collected build-info should be published to Artifactory using the 'JFrog Publish Build Info' task.

inputs.name: module
inputs.label: Module name
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Module name.
Optional module name for the build-info.
The collected build-info should be published to Artifactory using the 'JFrog Publish Build Info' task.

inputs.name: projectKey
inputs.label: Project key
inputs.helpMarkDown: JFrog Project key.

inputs.name: includeEnvVars
inputs.label: Include environment variables
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select to include environment variables in the published build info.

inputs.name: dryRun
inputs.label: Dry run
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select if you'd like the task to only indicates which artifacts would have been affected.
If not, the command is fully executed as specified

inputs.name: failNoOp
inputs.label: Fail task if no files were affected
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select if you'd like the task to fail if no files were affected.

inputs.name: threads
inputs.label: # of threads
inputs.helpMarkDown: The number of parallel threads that should be used.

inputs.name: retries
inputs.label: # of retries
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Retries.
Number of HTTP retries.

inputs.name: splitCount
inputs.label: # of splits
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The number of segments into which each file should be split for download (provided the artifact is over the "min split" in size).
To download each file in a single thread, set to 0.

inputs.name: minSplit
inputs.label: The minimum size in KB for splitting files
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Files larger than the specified number will be split into equally sized "# of splits" segments.
Any files smaller than the specified number will be downloaded in a single thread. If set to -1, files are not split.
The default value is 5120

inputs.name: validateSymlinks
inputs.label: Validate symlinks are pointing to existing and unchanged files
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Validation is done by comparing file's sha1.
Applicable to files and not directories.

inputs.name: syncDeletesPathLocal
inputs.label: Path to sync and delete files from in the local file system
inputs.helpMarkDown:
If you'd like to sync dependencies after the download, set a specific local file system path. Leave empty otherwise.
If set, after the download completes, this path will include only the dependencies downloaded during this download operation. The other files under this path will be deleted.

inputs.name: preserveSymlinks
inputs.label: Preserve soft links structure in Artifactory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select if you'd like that Symlink file representation will contain the symbolic link and checksum properties.

inputs.name: setDebianProps
inputs.label: Set Debian properties
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select if you'd like to Specify the distribution/component/architecture of the package.
Used for Debian packages only.

inputs.name: syncDeletesPathRemote
inputs.label: Path to sync and delete files from in Artifactory
inputs.helpMarkDown:
If you'd like to sync artifacts after the upload, set a specific path in Artifactory. Leave empty otherwise.
If set, after the upload completes, this path will include only the artifacts uploaded during this upload operation. The other files under this path will be deleted.
